attacks.expected_behavior: A file named wmi_advanced.txt is created in the user's TEMP directory containing the text 'Advanced WMI payload'. The command uses Base64-encoded Unicode PowerShell to avoid plaintext command-line logging and leverages WMI via PowerShell for process creation.

attacks.description: Basic encrypted channel using OpenSSL s_server and s_client with a self‑signed certificate.
attacks.expected_behavior: The server process listens on port 4444 with TLS; the client connects, sends "test", and receives the same data encrypted over the channel.

attacks.command: socat TCP-LISTEN:5555,reuseaddr,fork OPENSSL:127.0.0.1:8443,verify=0 & echo "hello" | openssl s_client -quiet -connect 127.0.0.1:5555 -verify 0
attacks.description: Intermediate encrypted tunnel using socat to wrap a TCP listener with OpenSSL.
attacks.expected_behavior: socat creates a listener on port 5555 that forwards traffic through an OpenSSL encrypted connection to port 8443; the client sends "hello" which is transmitted encrypted and echoed back.

attacks.command: powershell -Command "Add-Type -AssemblyName System.Windows.Forms; $screen = [System.Windows.Forms.Screen]::PrimaryScreen.Bounds; $width = $screen.Width; $height = $screen.Height; $point = New-Object System.Drawing.Point(0, 0); $bounds = [System.Drawing.Rectangle]::FromLTRB($screen.Left, $screen.Top, $screen.Right, $screen.Bottom); $bmp = New-Object System.Drawing.Bitmap($width, $height); $graphics = [System.Drawing.Graphics]::FromImage($bmp); $graphics.CopyFromScreen($point, [System.Drawing.Point]::Empty, $bounds.Size); $path = '$env:TEMP\\screen_capture_basic.png'; $bmp.Save($path); $graphics.Dispose(); $bmp.Dispose();"
attacks.description: Basic screen capture using PowerShell and .NET assemblies loaded via Add-Type, saving screenshot to temp directory.
attacks.expected_behavior: A full-screen screenshot is captured and saved as 'screen_capture_basic.png' in the user's TEMP directory using .NET graphics classes via PowerShell.

attacks.description: Intermediate method simulating screen capture after copying a system binary to temp, then executing encoded PowerShell command to capture screen.
attacks.expected_behavior: Copies a legitimate system binary (for simulation), then runs an encoded PowerShell script that captures a 200x200 pixel region of the screen and saves it as 'screen_intermediate.png' in TEMP.

attacks.description: Advanced screen capture across all monitors, creating a directory in TEMP and saving individual screenshots per display.
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates a subdirectory '_scr' in TEMP, captures each active screen individually, and saves them with filenames including the device name (e.g., 'advanced_capture-\\\\.\\\\DISPLAY1.png').

attacks.description: Takes a full-screen screenshot using gnome-screenshot and saves it to the Desktop
attacks.expected_behavior: Captures the entire screen and saves the image as screenshot.png on the user's Desktop

attacks.description: Uses ImageMagick's import tool to capture the root window (full screen) and save it to the runtime directory
attacks.expected_behavior: Captures the full desktop and saves it as screen_capture.png in the user's runtime directory if ImageMagick is installed

attacks.description: Uses ffmpeg to capture a single frame from the X11 display and save it as a JPEG image
attacks.expected_behavior: Records one frame from the current X11 session and saves it as capture.jpg in the temporary directory

attacks.description: Add a new Registry entry to the Run key for the current user, launching notepad.exe at login.
attacks.expected_behavior: Notepad will launch at user login.

attacks.description: Add a new Registry entry to the Run key for all users, launching notepad.exe at system startup. This requires admin privileges.
attacks.expected_behavior: Notepad will launch at system startup for all users.

attacks.description: Remove a Registry entry from the Run key for the current user.
attacks.expected_behavior: The specified Registry entry will be deleted.

attacks.command: crontab -l 2>/dev/null | { cat; echo '@reboot /bin/sh -c \"sleep 30 && echo \\\'Cron reboot job executed\\\' > ~/.cache/cron-reboot.log 2>/dev/null\"'; } | crontab -
attacks.description: Adds a cron job to execute a benign command at system reboot
attacks.expected_behavior: A cron job is added to the current user's crontab that runs at reboot. After boot, it waits 30 seconds then writes a test message to a log file. This persists across reboots without requiring GUI login.

attacks.description: Basic RDP connection using rdesktop
attacks.expected_behavior: Establish a remote desktop connection to the specified server

attacks.description: Intermediate RDP connection with shared disk
attacks.expected_behavior: Establish a remote desktop connection with a shared disk

attacks.description: Advanced RDP connection with shared disk and sound redirection
attacks.expected_behavior: Establish a remote desktop connection with a shared disk and sound redirection

attacks.expected_behavior: The malicious executable will be downloaded and executed

attacks.description: Downloads a malicious PowerShell script from a URL and executes it
attacks.expected_behavior: The malicious PowerShell script will be downloaded and executed

attacks.expected_behavior: The malicious HTML file will be created and opened in the default browser
